website_summaries.verdict: A natural nontoxic cleaner that works well on tired, dried-out bags, boots, and purses.
pros: Good for cowhide and natural leather restoration
cons: Hard to apply, applicator could be better
Leaves sticky finish, may remove dyes and leave white residue

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic
customer_reviews.text: Posted a before and after. This was an expensive Cole Haan purse that looked so bla!! Now it looks super!!! The bottle is so funny. I was laughing so hard!! Read #3 and 4!!
customer_reviews.author: Sushiyaya

customer_reviews.title: Leather Milk
customer_reviews.text: I have owned my pair of antique Omersa rhinos for 13 years and apply leather protectant once or so per year. I decided to give Chamberlain a try and this milk is just what these rhinos needed. It has a somewhat pleasant aroma- similar to amaretto. I used the supplied terrycloth pad and some color did rub off of the antique finish which I expected- not a big deal for these nearly 100 year old footstools. I've attached some comparison photos: top is before, bottom is after results.
customer_reviews.author: sanjayf

customer_reviews.title: Before and after pictures - Saddleback Leather tablet sleeve
customer_reviews.text: I own fourteen different Saddleback Leather items, and most of them are the tobacco color. Chamberlain's Leather Milk does a great job of nourishing the leather. Attached are three pictures of my wife's tablet sleeve; 1) 'Before' (one year of normal use), 2) 'Coat 1' (one application of leather milk), 3) 'Coat 2' (second application of leather milk). The Leather Milk doesn't make the tablet sleeve look like new - it makes it look better than new. It does darken the leather a bit initially, but that lightens up again with time.
customer_reviews.author: Timothy Barrett

customer_reviews.title: Not a thirsty chair anymore!
customer_reviews.text: I haven't purchased a leather conditioner before, so I have nothing to compare this product to, but I can still say it worked pretty great! I am satisfied with how my chair came out. My leather chair was in desperate need of some conditioning (it looked super thirsty!). After I used the milk, the chair looked much better. The color, the texture, the overall appearance of the chair is much more appealing. In my photo, the left side is conditioned, and the right arm is untouched. See the difference for yourself.
customer_reviews.author: sarah

customer_reviews.title: Did Nothing Good on My Car Seats
customer_reviews.text: This product did absolutely nothing postivie for my leather seats in a late model Acura. In fact the one seat. I put it on, turned my nice tight looking seat into something less tight with ruffles or something. Maybe it's good for old bags, but not as a regular conditioner. I used amorall on my old Honda with leather seats and that at least made the seats look less dry. This did not. I'd buy amorall over this product. Going to stop by my dealer and get the OEM stuff.
customer_reviews.author: Apathetic

customer_reviews.title: Good cleaner, not so great conditioner
customer_reviews.text: This product works well as a leather cleaner, but in my opinion it's not a very good leather conditioner. I far prefer Beesbutter leather conditioner for that purpose. If you have relatively new leather that needs to be cleaned I think this would work decently, but if you have older leather that is dry I did not have good results for that purpose with this product, and had better results with others. It smells nice, kind of like cherry.
customer_reviews.author: Philonious

customer_reviews.title: Awesome customer service.  Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: I've used this on all of my favorite shoes and boots. Then I used it on my purse. It's enjoyable seeing how much improvement you can see on beat up leather. The scent is what sold me on this product. I loved that it was an almond scent. But the results are so much better. Just look at my boots. The left boot was cleaned/conditioned with the leather milk, and the right is the before. It took about 2 minutes to clean them up. Highly recommended. Also their customer service is top notch.
customer_reviews.author: RileyD

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for
customer_reviews.text: I've been looking for a polish to use on my leather furniture that I got from crate and barrel . A few months ago I tried another highly rated brand, but it left a big greasy stain on my chair . I've just finished cleaning and conditioning my chair and my couch with Chamberlain's, and for me, the results are fantastic. The edges of a couple of the cushions were starting to look pretty dry and this made them very supple and added a nice sheen to all of the leather. I couldn't be happier - it was exactly what I was hoping for . Bonus: it smells good and it's easy to apply
customer_reviews.author: L. Richardson

customer_reviews.title: Worst product I ever bought on Amazon!
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst money I ever spent on Amazon. The product smells wonderful. It also works terribly. Totally useless I wish I bought the small bottle first instead of the large one for almost $30. When you first apply it to leather it looks great. And then when it dries out within hours it looks worse than before. With a much more dull look. I work with leather all the time and I’m not an amateur at it. But this product is just not something I would recommend. I love that it’s made in the USA I just wish it wasn’t totally useless! If I’m missing something here the manufacture is welcomed to contact me and educate me.
customer_reviews.author: jerry a

customer_reviews.title: It's ok.
customer_reviews.text: The reason I knocked a star off is that you have to keep reapplying this stuff... I put them on my boots expecting it to last 6 months or more like previous leather protectants I've used. Nope... about 1.5-2 months later I had to put it back on... I did a thicker coat thinking I'd let it soak in more and that got me almost 3 months. I wear my boots all the time in all sorts of weather conditions and when I'm off-roading in the hills. If you don't mind putting it on 3-4 times a year this is the product for you.
customer_reviews.author: Trey Maryfield

customer_reviews.title: As advertised
customer_reviews.text: Worked as advertised. I use it to maintain and protect the leather on my motorcycle. Tough life for leather what with road dirt, UV rays from sun, acid rain and all the stuff Mother Nature can throw at it.
customer_reviews.author: Cole

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't darken leathers, but has a strong floral or fruity smell
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff—does what it's supposed to do. It looks and smells like women's hand lotion. I have used it on our leather couches and my wife's purse, and a little on my shoes. The nice thing about Chamberlains is that it does not darken the leather (much), unlike Obenaufs or Leather Honey, both of which initially darken leathers significantly. I made the mistake however of using a little chamberlains on the collar of my leather jacket—especially on clothing worn near the nose, it has a strong floral or tropical fruit odor that I did not like at all. Leather Honey is the only product I've found with no smell.
customer_reviews.author: sempervirens

customer_reviews.title: Dulls the leather and will remove color
customer_reviews.text: It dulled the leather and removed some of the black color of a pair of $800 calfskin boots I just purchased. I'm super disappointed as I even took the time out to call the company and I made sure to ask all the right questions before making my purchase. Wasted $20, super disappointing. I checked the website, but to my surprise they do not offer any satisfaction guarantee.
customer_reviews.author: brenda gregory

customer_reviews.title: Not a miracle product but may work OK.
customer_reviews.text: I like that this comes with an applicator and it smells good but the jury is still out of its effectiveness. I've put one coat of it on my car seats which needed conditioning badly and I saw minimal change. I tried this on another car and didn't see much of a change there either. Maybe after another application I'll see better results but I'll have to wait and see so it's 3 stars for now. This may work OK but it's not a miracle product.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Great Mik!
customer_reviews.text: Good stuff. I originally purchased it to condition a new leather purse I was rather surprised to find detailed instructions and an included buffing pad. The purse was a success. This brought out all the secret grains of the leather without overly darkening it. My next project will be the leather insert of the master bedroom bed headboard. This is a much better product than others I have used (many very expensive auto leather ones that made great promises and then failed to deliver). I only wish I had discovered it years ago. Highly recommended and I will certainly be purchasing again
customer_reviews.author: Glorianna

customer_reviews.title: not a cleaner!
customer_reviews.text: I agree with MTW who made this observation in June. I too, bought as a cleaner priority. It is evidently a conditioner only. But more importantly to me, after trying on a light colored pair of shoes which need some "conditioning ", it darkened them way too much. Yes, that warning is on the product label, but for me, this makes it unacceptable for its intended use-cleaning my light-colored car upholstery! Not a cleaner and stains!
customer_reviews.author: arkay

customer_reviews.title: LIttle to No Difference
customer_reviews.text: I read the reviews of this product and had fairly high expectations. I used it according to their directions, and it made little to no difference. Considering how expensive this product is, It was VERY disappointing. I do NOT recommendit.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly Brown

customer_reviews.title: Unlike a top selling Honey Conditioner, this Milk is fast absorbing, a little goes a long way!
customer_reviews.text: I tried both Chamberlains Milk and another Amazon top seller. I prefer Leather milk because it was fast absorbing, a little goes a long way and it smells really good. I love that it is natural as I like to apply it with my hands to avoid extra product lost in a cloth or sponge. The other product was the consistency of honey and was hard to spread, took a lot of product to get full coverage and took hours to dry. I sat on the couches as soon as I was done applying Leather milk and I couldn't tell I just put it on except the leather was soft and smooth. Good product.
customer_reviews.author: Kaspar The Ghost

customer_reviews.title: Maybe I bought the wrong product
customer_reviews.text: I have light tan leather seats in my car and they have some spots on them. I am looking for a product to actually clean the seats. This product did make them feel conditioned, but did not clean as I had hoped. It may be that they cannot actually be "cleaned". As for easy, it does take some rubbing to work it into the leather, so not really hard, but time consuming in this hurry, hurry world.
customer_reviews.author: RLG

customer_reviews.title: Its THE BEST,  forget the REST!
customer_reviews.text: The Blue dye out of my new jeans rubbed off on my saddle brown leather seats in my car, I couldnt get it off with anything. Bought this stuff after reading all the raving reviews of this Leather Milk made right here in The Good OL USA in Ft Worth In Texas. This Chamberlains Leather Milk is AbsoBloodyLootly incredible! Following the instructions on the back of the bottle,..you can really NOT go wrong! Blue Jeans Dye came off my leather seats with the first try! :-)
customer_reviews.author: critic

customer_reviews.title: You NEED this if you have leather shoes!!
customer_reviews.text: I was preparing myself to say goodbye to one of my favorite pairs of Everlane flats. I’ve conditioned these before with other leather conditioners, but the main problem was the gorgeous wine/burgundy color kept fading. I don’t know how they did it, but Chamberlain’s leather milk made the color come back!! All the scuffs and faded spots disappeared before my eyes. I didn’t believe these other reviews until I tried it myself. For full disclosure I did use one spray of Leather Doctor’s fatliquor, but it was the leather milk that did most of the conditioning. You get what you pay for. Don’t waste your money on all these other conditioners like I did.
customer_reviews.author: Skylar

customer_reviews.title: I have used everything and THIS is the BEST!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used all the conditioners and cleaners under the sun and I can unequivocally say this is by far the best out there! Don't worry about price, this is better than anything so I'll do the job faster. I'm very experienced with leather and craft it. I prepare leather too by oilling, dyeing, etc. So I know a thing or two and this makes the leather softer, don't leave residue and does not discolor. Get it!
customer_reviews.author: just_someone

customer_reviews.title: It moisturizers well and has a good almond scent
customer_reviews.text: It moisturizers well and has a good almond scent. The product initially cleared up small scratches on my leather but they returned once the treatment fully dried. From my experience it keeps the look of distressed leather and just seems to moisturize it. I sent a website inquiry to the manufacturer asking about the nature of its ingredients and never heard back a response. The product's website promised very fast replies which it failed to deliver on. The customer service and ability to contact the manufacturer seems lacking from my experience. Otherwise I was pretty happy with the performance and smell.
customer_reviews.author: Noah in NW

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?!!!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product, works into leather really well, smells nice (not like nasty chemicals like some other leather conditioners), all natural water based, why did it take me so long to find it?!!! Leaves leather feeling really nice, not waxy at all. Many of the other leather treatments I've tried have either been harsh petroleum based products (renaissance wax, at least it smells petroleum based) or oily (like mink oil) that leaves leather really waxy. Chamberlain's is so much better, try it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Robert L. Gorena

customer_reviews.title: Works ok. Smells ok.
customer_reviews.text: OK leather treatment. Will definitely darken your item, so be prepared for that. Smell is acceptable, but that's a personal call. It doesn't go very far. On the watery side, so the small bottle goes fast. Was used on a thick leather messenger bag. Kinda thirsty. Went through half the bottle in a few minutes, so consider that before you buy. Iv'e used all sorts of leather treatments before, and this is about the same as others. Nothing to write home about. Good marketing though.
customer_reviews.author: Carbonhead

customer_reviews.title: Seems to be working for the leather lining in my Arborist boots.
customer_reviews.text: I am using Chamberlain's Leather Milk in a very unique situation. I have a tree care business and the boots I wear have a leather lined interior that needs to be treated very often. It seems to be working. My boots were already beginning to crack and using this product seems to have stopped that. The leather interior of the boot also feels noticeably softer. Time will tell as I continue to use it if long term use will preserve the boot's leather lining. For right now I am reasonably happy with Chamberlain's Leather Milk. So far it seems to be a product that works well.
customer_reviews.author: Randy E. Morrissette

customer_reviews.title: Good quality product
customer_reviews.text: It seems like a good product, but be careful with layers. Even when you think that the leather is still dry and might need more product, wait for the next day. I have applied two layers of this lotion to 2 dry leather purses, and the next day the "excess" went waxy. The day before it looked like the leather had absorbed everything, but that was not the case. "Slow and steady wins the race" - I might says about this situation. Better to get your hands dirty twice (two days in a row) than to apply two layers the same day. Otherwise, great product and great customer service.
customer_reviews.author: dvrmasik

customer_reviews.title: Worth it for quality leather items.
customer_reviews.text: I own a Saddleback Leather backpack, and it sees a lot of travel locations, and a lot of wear. I will agree with many users who state that this *will* darken your leather products a little. But you gotta keep in mind that most substances that are designed to keep quality leather in good condition will likely darken it over time. Unless your fashion sense demands a pale leather item, I'd say go for it. It is far better to keep what you have in good condition. I've seen what dried up and damaged leather looks like. No thanks, I'll keep my stuff looking nice, even if its is a little dark.
customer_reviews.author: cyeote

customer_reviews.title: Very impressed!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, so I'm new to leather cleaning....i bought an old leather chair at an estate sale. I bought this product to clean it up and condition it. This product made it look like a new chair! Very easy to apply, almost has a silky feel, and it covers scratches and worn spots. Now, I'm sure I'll have to apply it again, but i don't mind. I tried an oil product and it was just messy and did not work like this product. Very impressed, and the label warning is funny.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Ritley

customer_reviews.title: I expected more
customer_reviews.text: The pictures shown by people and by the manufacturer showed fabulous results. That was not what I experienced. I put on multiple applications, and each time the scratches disappeared, until I buffed the leather after waiting an hour or so. I tried this multiple times, but the results have not changed. Things did improve some, so I am not totally discounting the products, but I thought it would be a lot more.
customer_reviews.author: g-ut

customer_reviews.title: Just like it used to be
customer_reviews.text: Just like it used to be. light smell and light coverage. Doesn't make the surface of my leather couches sticky or greasy. Long lasting effects, but I do like to touch up to keep the comfort in the couch. I will be buying more and wish I had purchased a larger container. There are leather seats in both trucks, my purses, boots, saddle, bridles, saddle bags. All these things will be benefiting. Thank you for this wonderful product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Saved my motorcycle gloves!
customer_reviews.text: OMG! I wish I took before/after pics!! I have (2) pairs of nice leather motorcycle gloves that I have owned for 8 years. A thick winter pair and a thin winter pair. I recently wrecked the winter pair using them as snow gloves in Montana. They lost their color and have been degrading steadily, but I paid some good money for these back in the day so I invested in this product. THEY LOOK BRAND NEW AGAIN! Unbelievable! Wiped and massaged right in and in some areas I put a second coat. Super easy to do and now I will have my nice gloves for years to come. I highly recommend this product!
customer_reviews.author: D. Deltenre

customer_reviews.title: Car seats look brand new
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my cars leather seats. I was pleasantly surprised by how easy it was to apply and buff. I have arthritis in my hands and I was worried I wouldn't be able to make the seats look nice but I had no problem applying the product. I used the sponge type applicator that came with the product. My seats look brand new. There is no streaking or spotting. I applied a very light coat and it worked well.
customer_reviews.author: L. Riley

customer_reviews.title: One of the Best!
customer_reviews.text: My wife used several different leather cleaners over the years including Michael Kors and some other brand but this one is her favorite. The shine that it gives my wife's purse doesn't look artificial, it looks natural and very attractive. We only use this brand. I just wish they made one with a spray nozzle but this is not really a con. Overall, I think Chamberlains makes one of the best leather care products from furniture to purse hands down.
customer_reviews.author: chang park

customer_reviews.title: Not for my purpose
customer_reviews.text: I'm giving this three stars and not five or one because it does clean leather and does a great job with that, however I was under the assumption that my faded spots on the arms of my sofa, love seat and club chair would be less noticeable. I was wrong, they stick out even more now. I watched the YouTube videos where it showed it covered faded spots and that was my intention of purchasing the product. If you want it for cleaning leather, it's nice. If you want it for blending in fading, it won't work. I had numerous email interactions with the company, but nothing resolved.
customer_reviews.author: SL

customer_reviews.title: For those who may not know what a "Bola" or ...
customer_reviews.text: For those who may not know what a "Bola" or "Boleadoras" is, you can consider it the "Lariat" of South american. The Gaucho's (Cowboys) use this very effective weapon to take down cattle at branding time. The Bola is three braided strains of leather about 36" long. At each end of the runs are leather covered rounded rocks. The loose ends are tied together and its ready to be throne at the back legs of a steer on the run. The one I found was in serious need of "conditioning"....Enter "Leather Milk". Over night the braids softened, my balls regained a flexible texture. This product preformed as advertised. I'm sure it will work for you....M L Greeson
customer_reviews.author: M L Greeson

customer_reviews.title: Trust it with your very best leather.
customer_reviews.text: I am an Obenauf user. I bought a saddleback leather doctors bag in tobacco color. I was very fearful of using any product that would darken my bag. I reached out to Dave at saddleback Leather and he told me Chamberlain’s is what he uses on all his leather. SOLD!!!! It made my bag look so beautiful and didn’t change the appearance much at all. Very good product.
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Just So So
customer_reviews.text: Really didnt do anything for my leather bomber. Leather is Lambskin. Maybe made is a little glossy, but then nothing. Not worth the price paid for me.
customer_reviews.author: The Dude

customer_reviews.title: Very nice smell. Reminds me of Ben and Jerry's cherry ...
customer_reviews.text: Very nice smell. Reminds me of Ben and Jerry's cherry Garcia ice cream. I bought two leather conditioners, this one and beesbutter. On my brand new jacket, this ended up being the one I'm using to try to undo the terrible waxy mess that beesbutter left over on my new leather jacket. That should tell you everything. Oh, and this stuff does seem to take a bit of the black ink out. But maybe that's because the jacket is new? Beesbutter also seemed to take a little black with it.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Elwood

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: My hopes were high, but this product didn't deliver the results that I anticipated. I wanted to add some luster to an 80s black leather Coach backpack, but this didn't do the trick. I followed the directions and the product was easy to apply. It went on well and looked nice going on, but when it dried it was back to its dull, black color.
customer_reviews.author: latrelle c.

customer_reviews.title: Worked maybe better
customer_reviews.text: Was fairly good I used this along with a couple other products to see what was best on leather fronted dressers. I’d say the mink oil for saddles made the leather softer but with shiny film this product absorbed and showed no major change in color. It did soften some too.
customer_reviews.author: joshua lewis

customer_reviews.title: Been using for 6 months! Love it!
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED REVIEW: Still such an amazing cleaner!!! My maid even asked where I got this as she was very impressed with it! I have dogs so they jump on the couches when I am not looking and leave muddy foot prints everywhere... This really takes all of that out and conditions the leather to replenish the natural oils! GET THIS!!! ORIGINAL REVIEW: Excellent at cleaning, conditioning and just making my leather couches brand new! I have been using this product for about 6 months now and I am very happy with it, very high quality formula and I use it on my leather purses, couches and shoes. I would absolutely recommend this product. Great buy!
customer_reviews.author: M. Contreras

customer_reviews.title: Magic in a bottle....
customer_reviews.text: I am not sure what kind of unicorn dust is in this product, but geeze, THIS STUFF IS MAGIC. I didn't take a before pic because I truly thought NOTHING could help my husband's 20 year old recliner. The pic is after I finished....this stuff is easy to use and my husband was STUNNED when he saw his chair
customer_reviews.author: Isabel Johannes

customer_reviews.title: Best So Far
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I needed something non-toxic, safe for dogs since they own the furniture! Goes on nicely, almond scented (careful- my dogs liked the smell and wanted to lick it!) and doesn't leave behind a film or a shiny finish. You can use the furniture within minutes, unlike some products that instruct to remain off the furniture for 24-hours (not happening!) after the application. No sticky residue. Will buy larger bottle next time, small bottle did three pieces of furniture, with probably one more application for all three.
customer_reviews.author: kelly

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for dry leather couch!
customer_reviews.text: Review of Chamberlains leather milk. I used this product on two used leather couches inquired, it improved the look, feel and color of my couches dramatically. Six months later and the couches still look and feel as good as when I applied the leather milk. Applies easily and smells great. Included application pad worked great but good for only one application. Don't drink not a dairy product!
customer_reviews.author: WB

customer_reviews.title: Revives the leather!
customer_reviews.text: Works great! Not sure it would get out stubborn or old stains but it made my leather handbags and boots look buttery soft and shiny. I was nervous to use on my creme Chloe bag but it worked like a charm! Only minor complaint is the dispensing mechanism is clunky - you have to shake it out and sometimes it sprays everywhere.
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany

customer_reviews.title: Good tonic for your leather
customer_reviews.text: Application was very easy and smooth with supplied applicator. Was not sticky and buffed up well. I think the trick is to shake well and not to use a heavy application or large amount at a time and work it in easy like. I used a microfiber cloth to buff with. Results on an old leather jacket were very good bringing some softness and luster back. Results on 4year old leather furniture were noticeably improved in luster, suppleness remained the same although it was very good to begin with. No staining was observed, all leather was black or dark brown
customer_reviews.author: Max Parrott

customer_reviews.title: Great look, great function
customer_reviews.text: Chamberlain's leather milk is all around a great product. I can't compare it to other similar products on the market because it is the first leather conditioner I have bought. Simply because they put so much effort into making their product look beautiful and feel accessible, as a customer, I was more than willing to pay a few extra dollars to stand behind this brand. It works very well, too. Very little leather milk is needed in order to spiff up a pair of boots – or any leather thing. If I encounter any problems with the leather milk, I will change my review. But until then, it comes with my recommendations.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Will darken your leather a bit.
customer_reviews.text: I guess it depends how light your leather actually is. I think this is true with MOST leather conditioners. Also, make sure to TEST on your lather before applying. I did not mind that it made my bad just a bit darker than it once was. It looks of higher quality now. Will be using it Once every two months or so to keep leather soft and hydrated.
customer_reviews.author: Josay

customer_reviews.title: I prefer Obenauf's Leather Oil
customer_reviews.text: I've been using Obenauf's Leather Oil for about a year on my leather boots and Saddleback Leather wallet and briefcase. The Obenaufs product has a much more pronounced impact on leather. The leather absorbs it and darkens nicely. Having Chestnut colored Saddleback items, this was a welcomed change. The Chamberlain's product just felt like I was rubbing water on the leather. That being said, I am still glad I purchased it because I would not use the Obenauf's product on softer leather like car leather or softer shoes. Obviously, the Chamberlain product is excellent looking at reviews, but if you have tough leather products (boots, briefcases) that you don't mind having a darker tone, I would go with the Obenauf's.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BUY THIS STUFF
customer_reviews.text: I can’t believe what a great job this product did for me. I had two OLD (30+years) Coach purses. On both of them, the leather looked like hell—beat up, scratched, dry. Yes, I know I could spend $150 to have Coach restore them but I watched a YouTube video that recommended using Chamberlain’s. What did I have to lose? Love both purses and they have years and years of use left in them—just looked worn. After one application of Formula 1, they honestly look new. I couldn’t be any happier with the results. I highly recommend this!
customer_reviews.author: Catherine Lanham

customer_reviews.title: Im one of the few that this just didnt work for.
customer_reviews.text: I have a natural leather bag, much like a saddlebag, in a medium brown color that was just looking a little scratched up. I bought this to rejuvenate the color, maybe buff out the scratches. By bag actually looks somewhat dryer and cracked than it did before using this product. Ive found that I need to use it almost every other day or my bag looks incredibly worn. It could be the bag, but Im going to try another product to see if I get different results.
customer_reviews.author: Tiff Waters

customer_reviews.title: Great for conditioning vachetta leather
customer_reviews.text: Great for conditioning the vachetta leather on my Louis Vuitton bags! Conditions without drastically darkening the leather. Just be sure to apply a thin, even layer (I use a small makeup sponge to apply). Very easy to use and yields a great result.
customer_reviews.author: Kristen

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work for me
customer_reviews.text: I have a leather couch and ottoman that I bought new 10 years ago. I love these pieces, but they're starting to show their age with some cracking and worn parts. I was really excited to find this product as I thought it would be like hitting a "reset" button on my furniture. Unfortunately that wasn't the case. The images I've attached are AFTER TWO APPLICATIONS of Leather Milk. I'd have provided a "before" pic, but it would look exactly the same. I feel my couch and ottoman were a perfect example of what this product should have made look new. As you can see it did not. Buyer be warned.
customer_reviews.author: Stu Kiesow

customer_reviews.title: Great product. Conditions leather perfectly
customer_reviews.text: Used them on some new boots I got. It will prevent thick wrinkles in the leather from developing. Doesn't make the leather too much darker, just make sure you only use a tiny bit at a time on the pad it comes with and rub it into the pad well before you apply it to the leather, then do light and even strokes in a circular motion all over the leather. It gives it good water protection but doesn't leave any oily film on it like mink oil will. One bottle of it will probably last me a lifetime. All around a great product, I wouldn't recommend anything above it.
customer_reviews.author: karis domini

customer_reviews.title: Amazing stuff
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is amazing! It instantly made everything leather softer and shines it up a bit. Don’t worry about purchasing the larger bottle. We did a smaller 3 sweater leather couch, shoes, purses and a couple other tiny things and still had a 1/4 the bottle. A little does go a long way even overusing it. Also has a pleasant smell versus that chemical smell.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy T.

customer_reviews.title: Works well on genuine leather
customer_reviews.text: I had a genuine leather handbag that I purchased in Japan that got some dirt on it. I tried this product, hesitantly, and it worked very well without leaving stains. Like anything, it's probably best to try the product in a small, discrete area prior to cleaning the whole item.
customer_reviews.author: MissM

customer_reviews.title: Very Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: This leather milk restored my old leather jacket to like-new condition! I hadn't realized how bad my jacket had gotten until applying this leather treatment. It restored the leather to 95% of its original color and luster. The only knock on it I can give is that the applicator pad is a bit cheap. Small fuzzy parts came off during application which was a bit annoying and the pad is not designed to get into nooks and crannies. Other than that I would highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't smell, leaves bag looking great!
customer_reviews.text: I was on the fence about spending more than $10 on a conditioner to spruce up my new to me vintage designer bag - but mannnnn, am I happy to have spent it! It doesn't smell, and you can actually think of it as lotion for a bag... if that makes any sense. It goes on easily, and as long as you buff out the condition with the pad that comes along with it, then it'll make your item look good as spankin' new. But don't take my word for it - go and get you one!
customer_reviews.author: Jen P

customer_reviews.title: Leather Milk WILL save your hide!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best leather product line I have ever used! I have a 20 yr old Natuzzi sofa that had seen better days. It was scratched from cats, and the middle cushion was dry, rough, and cracking. I used the healing balm first on the scratches and creased areas, then I followed up with the formula number 5. The sofa looks like a recent purchase. It has been a couple weeks since I applied Leather Milk , and I still can’t see any of the cracks or scratches. I can’t say enough about these products! They are worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: LT

customer_reviews.title: I like that it came with an applicator pad
customer_reviews.text: I have used this thus far on a pair of Frye boots and a Laura Ashley belt. The conditioner immediately made them softer, more supple, and more finished looking. Both are black and there was no discoloration. I like that it came with an applicator pad. It went on smoothly and buffed off to a pretty gloss. Of course, the true test is the test of time, so I will update if I notice any long-term pros or cons.
customer_reviews.author: JBL

customer_reviews.title: Seemed  to actually dry out the leather
customer_reviews.text: I used it on a leather couch 2 years old and it seemed to acutally dry out the leather. it also removed any sheen it once had. Don't waste your money and damage your fine leather furniture. I should have bought the leather protector from Tema when I bought the couch.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: Easy to apply
customer_reviews.text: I needed a good cleaner/conditioner for my saddleback leather purse. I use it every day and am very rough on it. I researched Amazon and saw that the Saddleback company originally came out with this product, so I decided it would be a safe bet. It comes out like a milky white thin substance so be careful not to waste it. It rubs in easily. It did not change the color of my leather, just refreshed it. It says for use not on soft leather. I have a pair of boots that are somewhat soft. I'm going to try it out on an indiscreet place on the boot and see how it goes. I'll post an update when I do.
customer_reviews.author: dharma77

customer_reviews.title: So glad I bought this for my leather items
customer_reviews.text: This worked so nice on my leather handbag. There was a horrible grey stain on my burgundy purse and this removed it and really cleaned up the rest of the purse. I would highly recommend this product. They also have a sense of humor on their label.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy V Davies

customer_reviews.title: Not cleaning as I expected
customer_reviews.text: Did not really clean as well as I expected for the price and the compliments it received. Or my car wasn't dirty enough :) I have white-ish (more like light tan) leather seats, and it only removed some really obvious marks (but not all the way, maybe like 80-90%), even after I pressed really hard and rubbed one area for about 5 minutes. Don't think I'll buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Jelena

customer_reviews.title: the bomb...
customer_reviews.text: we use it on smooth leather on home furnishings, vehicles, shoes, boots, belts, jackets, luggage, bags, purses, whatever. it's not thick at all but it REALLY does a nice job. it's worth the extra bones to protect what you have and definitely help preserve, condition, and maintain your stuff. have been using for quite awhile now & am quite pleased indeed with results. follow directions properly though. this is a well made concoction that i'd never heard of 'til reading some helpful reviews about the product. glad i did and thanks to those whose objectivity helped me make a wise/ informed purchasing decision.
customer_reviews.author: rw24

customer_reviews.title: Smells great- conditions beautifully!
customer_reviews.text: Loved the smell of this product. Used it on two soft leather Micheal Kor handbags, and one leather Fossil bag, and it conditioned them beautifully with one quick application (per the directions). The only reason I gave four stars instead of five, is because it did not remove an ink mark (from pen) from the outside of the handbag, although I was able to use hairspray and then follow up with this conditioner after removing ink with the hairspray from the leather. Great product! Arrived quickly, packaged perfectly. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: Used on a leather bag and a leather wallet and it worked as advertised. Also used the Liniment No. 2 and then the water protection No. 3 on the same bag. It looks beautiful, cleared all the dirt expertly and it is still soft and feels like it should. I am very happy with this product and the results on my bag and will not hesitate to recommend it to friends. On the wallet dye showed up on the sponge, but it did not change the color of the wallet. Best to test the color fastness before putting it on your leather as recommended in the directions. It is a good cleaner!
customer_reviews.author: Kitter

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic product.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is awesome! I bought it to soften/condition a leather gun holster. It wasn't the highest grade leather and was very stiff. I followed the directions, then let it soak in for half an hour and wiped it off. The leather was much softer and supple. Today, I used it on our leather sofa and my leather recliner. It made the scratches on the sofa from our dog's nails almost disappear. It cleaned the leather well too. The leather looks brand new, feels softer, and there is no sticky or slick residue. I can't wait to use it on the car's leather interior!
customer_reviews.author: HuntandFishVATop Contributor: Beekeeping

customer_reviews.title: This stuff works
customer_reviews.text: I used this on a dark brown sofa that had not had any love for years and had developed light "veins" in areas of high use. After a few applications the "veins" essentially disappeared. The "veins" reappeared after each application but stay away longer each time I apply it. I agree with the other negative comments about the packaging. It is a liquid in a tall skinny bottle with a screw top. It is not very stable even on the flattest surface and is difficult to get a measured portion out. I will probably transfer it to one of those squeezable commercial ketchup dispensers with a spout.
customer_reviews.author: Georgie

customer_reviews.title: Bags look like new!
customer_reviews.text: Smells amazing (like almond milk!). I used it to rehydrate some tortured leather bags of mine (an animal peed on them, which resulted in a long soapy soak in the sink). Since the milk is uncolored, I was able to use it on dark red and purple leather. Both bags look and feel amazing. I slathered it on with the included applicator pad and let them sit for a day. I used a lot, since my leather was very dry. I look forward to using it on other leather products that I own, that just need a bit of of a rejuvenation.
customer_reviews.author: sm

customer_reviews.title: Great at cleaning and reviving
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is great! I used it first on two leather chairs that had been in storage for years and had really dried out. They look like they did before they went into storage now. I have also used it on a very dirty leather chair and ottoman. It did a great job of pulling out the dirt and restoring the luster.
customer_reviews.author: adopt shelter animals

customer_reviews.title: Great Leather Conditioner!
customer_reviews.text: This product is great! Really conditions the leather well and smells great too! It does darken the leather a fair amount so if you are worried about lighter colors staying light, I recommend Bick 4. Bick 4 will not darken the leather but does not seem to actually condition leather quite a well as Leather Milk. This product seems to fit right in between Bick 4 and Leather Honey in terms of hydrating the leather and also darkening the leather. Bick 4 for light conditioning with no color change, Leather Milk for medium conditioning with some darkening of the leather, and Leather Honey for heavy conditioning but substantial color darkening. I will purchase more when this product runs out.
customer_reviews.author: James M.

customer_reviews.title: I imagine it will keep nice seats nice
customer_reviews.text: It cleans well, I imagine it will keep nice seats nice, but I was a little disappointed by the restoration it offered to worn leather (I've tried on seats and shoes so far). I'll update if I find repeated use improves my experience. For badly worn leather I'd consider a lanolin based cream like Hide Food (Griot's garage used to sell it).
customer_reviews.author: Blueblur1984

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful product
customer_reviews.text: Bought my Kia Sedona after hurricane took out my other Sedona. This one came with leather seats. At first I didn’t like leather seats. They were hard and uncomfortable. Ordered this leather milk couple months ago. Just used it. Absolutely wonderful!!! Softens leather and makes it feel soft, luxurious, and wonderful. Will be ordering again and again.
customer_reviews.author: Quail

customer_reviews.title: The Only Leather Conditional You'll Ever Need
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product at the recommendation of Saddleback Leather. My briefcase/bag is about 10 years old now and I've only ever treated it once before (maybe 7 years ago) with mineral oil. Unlike mineral oil, this product went on mess-free and absorbed into the dry leather evenly making it soft and supple instantaneously. The process was much easier, in fact I applied a second application a few days later because my leather was SO dry. The lotion smells nice and comes with a nice 4-5" round application/buffing pad. I will absolutely recommend this product. With two applications I only used about half of the bottle.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Moya

customer_reviews.title: ... read all the reviews before buying so was expecting great things from this product
customer_reviews.text: I read all the reviews before buying so was expecting great things from this product. It was so so. I used it as directed on bottle but didn't get the results the other reviewers did. Quite watery for the cleanser and the liniment was a little thicker but was a little tacky feeling. I put three coating of the liniment on my leather but didn't see any difference. I even buffed it like it said but nothing changed. So my rating is 3 stars and a okay product.
customer_reviews.author: Deloris

customer_reviews.title: Works really well
customer_reviews.text: Easy to apply and beautifully restored an antique leather camel saddle (weird use, I know). Also, the instructions are hilarious!
customer_reviews.author: Milo Grika

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product- buying more
customer_reviews.text: OK, I am writing this review without even being asked to do so. I was shopping for new boots because unfortunately the boots that I purchased a few years ago had started to look ratty. Scratched, etc... When I googled how to rejuvenate leather boots, this product came up. What a game changer! Awesome product- buying more!!! I wish I had done before and after pictures for you!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa

customer_reviews.title: Final Stage of Leather Renovation - The most Satisfying Phase
customer_reviews.text: I used the product for the final coating of my favorite chair (37 years old). After restoring the color and cracking this product was applied. The milk consistency made it easy to apply. The finish sheen was very good. I now have my favorite chair back in the living room. It looks good enough for my wife to allow it. Great product and service. Thanks
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchased for a second time because of how well it ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased for a second time because of how well it does what it does. Have used this to keep my wife's fancy purse looking new for years. Works well with belts, leather upholstery, and probably leather coats, too. Not for suede or nubuck. Will darken the product a little, looks darkest immediately after application but stays subtly but noticeably darker afterwards, too.
customer_reviews.author: North Star State Teacher

customer_reviews.title: Really works great
customer_reviews.text: Really a great product. Was going to throw out my worn, sun bleached sofa. Now it looks like new. So happy to save sofa.
customer_reviews.author: Linda

customer_reviews.title: This stuff WORKS!!!
customer_reviews.text: Decided to order this instead of a leather cream I have used for years. LOVE it! Works great, dries quickly, and with a quick buff you’re done. It is NOT sticky or oily once buffed. The ONLY reason i didn’t give it 5 stars is because it didn’t put as much color back into the sofa as I had expected. Definitely order this product!!!
customer_reviews.author: Timothy M.

customer_reviews.title: Made my 1 year old leather wallet look new again.
customer_reviews.text: I had a couple of leather handbags that needed some love. This added a wonderful sheen and suppleness back to the bags. This was easy to apply and it soaked in fairly quickly so I could use the bag again. It made my leather wallet look new again. I highly recommend this leather milk. I can hardly wait to use it on more leather items. The scent was neutral and this did not leave a film or anything on the bags. So I would love to try this on some old leather shoes and perhaps even my couch. I am very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Manley

customer_reviews.title: They look much better now! Boots were light colored "blonde" leather
customer_reviews.text: Bought #1 for an old pair of cowboy boots that were showing their age. They look much better now! Boots were light colored "blonde" leather, and they did get a tad darker in the "after". However, the boots were so dry and sad looking that Im wondering if they're actually restored to the original leather color! Got on a roll and did two other pairs of shoes and they have a new lease on life! The product is very thin, and a bit runny and the "spout" (small hole in plastic cover) is awkward. Be careful pouring it out onto the supplied buffer (or any cloth). I had a couple small spills.. thus the 4 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Amy S

customer_reviews.title: Helped me make a sale!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a used black leather Coach purse that looked a little rough for $10. After I used the Leather Milk on it, it shined right up and looked and felt so pretty again. And...I sold it for $55!
customer_reviews.author: Rita Smith

customer_reviews.title: Bringing leather back to life!!!  WOW!
customer_reviews.text: I own a saddleback leather bag and used it for a couple of years before I even considered applying a conditioner. I know, I know...not the smartest move! After a recommendation from another saddleback leather bag owner (my brother) I bought the Leather Milk product. It has a watery feel and comes with a cotton applicator. It was a breeze to apply and brought my bag back to "like new" feel and look...maybe even better than new in look and feel! :-) The leather is softer and the scratches seemed to have vanished! Maybe it's magic????!!!! I've used this now on my iPad leather cover as well as my wallet - again the results were fantastic! Definitely 5 stars!!!
customer_reviews.author: J. D. McGee

customer_reviews.title: If you own leather products, this is the one ...
customer_reviews.text: If you own leather products, this is the one thing you should buy to protect them. I’ve been using this for years on shoes, jacket, backpack and other leather odds and ends. It keeps them soft and looking new.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew M.

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: I had a black leather jacket that was about the "loudest" jacket I'd ever had. It would squeak and swish every time I wore it which meant I wore it less and less. I finally decided to see if I could try something to make it better and settled on Chamberlain's after researching different products. What a difference! My jacket went from very stiff to pliable after applying Chamberlain's as directed. I also applied Chamberlain's #3 Waterproofer at the same time. It's like I have a brand new jacket. I am very happy with this product.
customer_reviews.author: David J Stanwick

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I did not realize that I needed to moisture our leather furniture (chairs, barstools, sofa) on a periodic basis. So I used this on some new items and some old, worn leather furniture. You can see the difference on all the pieces. Very happy with the product, but not happy that I have to periodically moisturize the furniture.
customer_reviews.author: Valhalla3

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Best leather conditioner i have used. Keeps the leather soft and supple without out being slippery like most conditioners. Highly recommend and will buy again
customer_reviews.author: Villam L

customer_reviews.title: Run it through your airbrush for perfect coverage
customer_reviews.text: Top of the line leather treatment/conditioner. I used it on a beautiful hand made leather coat nearly 25 years old. Before treatment leather was dry as a bone and fading. After treatment leather looks almost new again. It soaks up the milk which is what makes the leather hydrated and supple. It dries quickly and has a slight almond smell to it. For those hard to reach areas I put some leather milk through my airbrush and finished the coat with a nice detailing. It's the perfect consistency to run through an airbrush.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Leathermilk works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Conditioned the jacket without changing the appearance or color. This is not a waterproofing treatment. Only time will tell, but this looks to be the perfect conditioner for a nice lambskin flight jacket. The leather looks, smells, and feels wonderful afterwards
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very satisfied with the result
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a leather satchel that I had purchased recently. Very satisfied with the result. Leather darkened very slightly but became very uniform in shade. Satchel now looks much softer in appearance and actually feels that way too. This was a large 18 inch satchel and used about 1/4 of the bottle for a generous application. Be sure and buff with the supplied polishing pad for a great finished look.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Zolezzi

customer_reviews.title: Good Stuff!!
customer_reviews.text: This is good stuff!! I cleaned the upholstery and dash in our Class A motorhome, then applied Chamberlain's Leather Milk Conditioner and Cleaner - it did a really great job. Did not change colour (light buff coloured leather) and it did not leave any sticky or greasy feel. I'm very happy with this product and would certainly buy it again.
customer_reviews.author: Shari Lynn Gelinas

customer_reviews.title: This stuff rocks.
customer_reviews.text: This stuff is awesome. I have a pair of Tecova Ostrich boots. I use this stuff before I walk out the door every time. It keeps the leather looking and feeling new, always. I use it for other leather items too. It rejuvenates all of my leather shoes and keeps them from wearing out.
customer_reviews.author: Robert D. Griffith

customer_reviews.title: Keep your leather looking fresh!
customer_reviews.text: I recommend this leather care item. I used it on a 15 year old leather coat and now it looks like new. As a tip I would say that the sponge pad thing that comes with it appears to soak up a lot of the product, so next time I plan to use a rag of some kind. I don't mind buying more of the product, I just want it to go into my leather and not the sponge! I am very pleased with Chamberlain's Leather Milk. You [probably] spend a ton on your leather items, so the $20 dollars is easily worth it to keep them looking good and protected.
customer_reviews.author: Xak

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work
customer_reviews.text: When I first put it on it looked great. A big improvement but as it dried it went back to the same as it was before. Would not buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Maryann

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: Great product! Cleans, moisturizes, shines, makes my leather look like new again. I have some Frye leather boots that I put through hell, I do a lot of walking downtown in a city that gets a lot of snow so my boots get wet, muddy, and salty. This stuff helps me keep them looking fresh. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: AnnaW

customer_reviews.title: This is the best!
customer_reviews.text: If you are serious about maintaining the looks and durablility of your leather, this is your product. I have used this "leather milk" to remove blemishes on leather car seats and brief cases where other quality leather care products have failed to accomplish the task. In addition, it is easy to apply and leaves no residue. I was a sceptic at first, but after two months of use and having tried the rest, I am convinced that Chamberlain's Leather Milk simply is the best product for restoring leather to its original look and feel with a minimum of effort. And, my car seats and briefcases have never looked better! B Michael Smith
customer_reviews.author: B Michael Smith

product_meta.title: Leather Milk Conditioner and Cleaner for Furniture, Cars, Purses and Handbags. All-Natural, Non-Toxic Conditioner Made in the USA. Leather Care Liniment No. 1. 2 Sizes. Includes Premium Applicator Pad
feature_bullets: RESTORE YOUR LEATHER TO LIKE NEW CONDITION - Chamberlain's Leather Milk all-natural Leather Care Liniment deep conditions, cleans, and restores what your leather needs to stay healthy.

FIX DRY, DULL, SCRATCHED LEATHER - Is your leather looking a bit used and abused? Fix that wear and tear with the best deep conditioner treatment on the market. Leather Milk has the perfect consistency, and applies effortlessly. Does NOT make your leather look greasy or feel sticky like some products.

ALL-NATURAL, CHEMICAL-FREE, AMAZING FRAGRANCE - Many conditioners use unnatural chemicals that leave an unpleasant smell and a sticky or greasy feel. Avoid chemicals at all costs as they will dry out your leather over time. Our formulas contain vital oils that nourish and strengthen leather.

ONLY LEATHER CARE RECIPE TRUSTED BY SADDLEBACK LEATHER COMPANY - Tested on millions of leather items over the years. Saddleback makes some of the best looking, highest-quality leather goods on the market. Each and every Saddleback Leather product is conditioned with Leather Milk before shipping to customers.

INCLUDES FREE REUSABLE PREMIUM APPLICATOR PAD - A little goes a long way. We supply you with our Premium Applicator Pad because we've found it to be the best applicator for leather goods, and it's reAmericable so it cuts down on environmental waste.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars1,719 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
